channel.title: Policy & Security Think Tank Updates
channel.description: Custom RSS feed from CSIS, CFR, and other policy institutions

item.title: Tech Edge: A Living Playbook for America’s Technology Long Game
item.description: Winning the tech race is not about any single breakthrough. Leadership requires competing across the full menu of technologies, developing the dexterity to build at speed and scale, and defending our domestic markets from nonmarket competition.

item.title: The Future of the WHO—and How the United States Can Shape It
item.description: The United States will officially end its relationship with the World Health Organization on January 22, 2026. But this break potentially opens the way for the next phase of reform. A smart transition back into U.S. membership is a path that will advance U.S. interests.

item.title: Bright Shiny Objects
item.description: This week, Bill Reinsch argues that the Trump administration’s approach to policymaking weakens public understanding and accountability.

item.title: The Geopolitics of Maduro’s Capture: What Does Operation Absolute Resolve Mean for Russia?
item.description: CSIS Americas Program Associate Fellow Henry Ziemer assesses the implications of the recent U.S. capture of Nicolás Maduro for Russia's strategy in the Western Hemisphere.

item.title: AI and Global Food Security: A Focus on Early Warning Systems
item.description: AI promises to improve food security early warning systems, which help inform decisionmakers and prevent hunger before it arises. CSIS experts unpack the risks and benefits of AI-enabled tools for food security early warning systems around the world.
